db:info.db:title: QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine Class
db:info.db:edition: Qt Virtual Keyboard | Commercial or GPLv3

db:abstract.db:para: The InputEngine class provides an input engine that supports C++ and QML integration.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The input engine is responsible for routing input events to input methods. The actual input logic is implemented by the input methods.
The input engine also includes the default input method, which takes care of default processing if the active input method does not handle the event.

db:section.db:title: enum QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::InputMode
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies the input mode for the input method.

db:td.db:para: The default input mode for latin text.
Fullwidth latin input mode for East Asian languages.

db:section.db:title: enum QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::PatternRecognitionMode
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies the input mode for the input method.

db:td.db:para: Pattern recognition mode for handwriting recognition.

db:section.db:title: enum QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::ReselectFlag
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies the rules for word reselection.

db:td.db:para: Activate the word before the cursor. When this flag is used exclusively, the word must end exactly at the cursor.
Activate the word after the cursor. When this flag is used exclusively, the word must start exactly at the cursor.
Activate the word at the cursor. This flag is a combination of the above flags with the exception that the word cannot start or stop at the cursor.

db:section.db:para: The ReselectFlags type is a typedef for QFlags<ReselectFlag>. It stores an OR combination of ReselectFlag values.

db:section.db:title: enum QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::TextCase
db:section.db:para: This enum specifies the text case for the input method.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] activeKey : const Qt::Key
db:section.db:para: This property holds the active key.
Currently pressed key.

db:section.db:title: inputMethod : QVirtualKeyboardAbstractInputMethod*
db:section.db:para: This property holds the active input method.
Use this property to set active the input method, or to monitor when the active input method changes.

db:section.db:title: inputMode : InputMode
db:section.db:para: This property holds the current input mode.
Use this property to get or set the current input mode. The InputEngine::inputModes provides list of valid input modes for current input method and locale.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] inputModes : const QList<int>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the available input modes for active input method.
The list of available input modes is dependent on the input method and locale. This property is updated when either of the dependencies changes.

db:section.db:title: [read-only, since QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0] patternRecognitionModes : const QList<int>
db:section.db:para: This property holds the list of available pattern recognition modes.
The list of available pattern recognition modes.
This property was introduced in QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] previousKey : const Qt::Key
db:section.db:para: This property holds the previous active key.
Previously pressed key.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] wordCandidateListModel : QVirtualKeyboardSelectionListModel* const
db:section.db:para: list model for the word candidate list.
Use this property to access the list model for the word candidate list.

db:section.db:title: [read-only] wordCandidateListVisibleHint : const bool
db:section.db:para: visible hint for the word candidate list.
Use this property to check if the word candidate list should be visible in the UI.

db:section.db:title: Qt::Key QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::activeKey() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the currently active key, or Qt::Key_unknown if no key is active.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::activeKeyChanged(Qt::Key key)
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the active key has changed.

db:section.db:title: QVirtualKeyboardInputContext *QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputContext() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the InputContext instance associated with the input engine.

db:section.db:title: QVirtualKeyboardAbstractInputMethod *QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputMethod() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the active input method.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputMethodChanged()
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the input method has changed.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputMethodReset()
db:section.db:para: Emitted when the input method needs to be reset.

db:note.db:para: This signal is automatically connected to QVirtualKeyboardAbstractInputMethod::reset() and InputMethod::reset() when the input method is activated.
This signal is automatically connected to QVirtualKeyboardAbstractInputMethod::update() and InputMethod::update() when the input method is activated.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputModeChanged()
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the input mode has changed.

db:section.db:title: QList<int> QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputModes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the list of available input modes.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::inputModesChanged()
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the available input modes have changed.

db:section.db:title: QList<int> QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::patternRecognitionModes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns list of supported pattern recognition modes.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0] void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::patternRecognitionModesChanged()
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the available pattern recognition modes have changed.
This function was introduced in QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0.

db:section.db:title: Qt::Key QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::previousKey() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the previously active key, or Qt::Key_unknown if no key has been active.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::previousKeyChanged(Qt::Key key)
db:section.db:para: Indicates that the previous key has changed.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0] bool QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::reselect(int cursorPosition, const QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::ReselectFlags &reselectFlags)
db:section.db:para: This function attempts to reselect a word located at the cursorPosition. The reselectFlags define the rules for how the word should be selected in relation to the cursor position.
The function returns true if the word was successfully reselected.
This function was introduced in QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::setInputMethod(QVirtualKeyboardAbstractInputMethod *inputMethod)
db:section.db:para: Sets inputMethod as the active input method.

db:section.db:title: [since QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0] QVirtualKeyboardTrace *QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::traceBegin(int traceId, QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::PatternRecognitionMode patternRecognitionMode, const QVariantMap &traceCaptureDeviceInfo, const QVariantMap &traceScreenInfo)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: QVirtualKeyboardTrace * traceBegin(int traceId, QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::PatternRecognitionMode patternRecognitionMode, const QVariantMap &traceCaptureDeviceInfo, const QVariantMap &traceScreenInfo)

db:section.db:para: Starts a trace interaction with the input engine.
The trace is uniquely identified by the traceId. The input engine will assign the id to the QVirtualKeyboardTrace object if the input method accepts the event.
The patternRecognitionMode specifies the recognition mode used for the pattern.
If the current input method accepts the event it returns a QVirtualKeyboardTrace object associated with this interaction. If the input method discards the event, it returns a NULL value.
The traceCaptureDeviceInfo provides information about the source device and the traceScreenInfo provides information about the screen context.
By definition, the QVirtualKeyboardTrace object remains valid until the traceEnd() method is called.
The trace interaction is ended by calling the traceEnd() method.
This function was introduced in QtQuick.VirtualKeyboard 2.0.

db:section.db:title: bool QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::traceEnd(QVirtualKeyboardTrace *trace)
db:section.db:para: Ends the trace interaction with the input engine.
The trace object may be discarded at any point after calling this function.
The function returns true if the trace interaction was accepted (i.e. the touch events should not be used for anything else).

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::virtualKeyCancel()
db:section.db:para: Reverts the active key state without emitting the key event. This method is useful when the user discards the current key and the key state needs to be restored.

db:section.db:title: bool QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::virtualKeyClick(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: bool virtualKeyClick(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers)

db:section.db:para: Emits a key click event for the given key, text and modifiers. Returns true if the key event was accepted by the input engine.

db:section.db:title: void QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::virtualKeyClicked(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers, bool isAutoRepeat)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: void virtualKeyClicked(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers, bool isAutoRepeat)

db:section.db:para: Indicates that the virtual key was clicked with the given text and modifiers. The isAutoRepeat indicates if the event is automatically repeated while the key is being pressed. This signal is emitted after the input method has processed the key event.

db:section.db:title: bool QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::virtualKeyPress(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers, bool repeat)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: bool virtualKeyPress(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers, bool repeat)

db:section.db:para: Called by the keyboard layer to indicate that key was pressed, with the given text and modifiers.

The key is set as an active key (down key). The actual key event is triggered when the key is released by the virtualKeyRelease() method. The key press event can be discarded by calling virtualKeyCancel().
The key press also initiates the key repeat timer if repeat is true.
Returns true if the key was accepted by this input engine.

db:section.db:title: bool QVirtualKeyboardInputEngine::virtualKeyRelease(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers)

db:methodsynopsis.db:synopsisinfo: bool virtualKeyRelease(Qt::Key key, const QString &text, Qt::KeyboardModifiers modifiers)

db:section.db:para: Releases the key at key. The method emits a key event for the input method if the event has not been generated by a repeating timer. The text and modifiers are passed to the input method.
Returns true if the key was accepted by the input engine.
